annotations.source_heading: Roommate wanted

postings.heading: Roommate wanted

postings.body:
Hello!
Up for grabs, the master bedroom of a two bed, two bath apartment that sits literally on top of the Columbia Heights metro at Highland Park Apartments!
Apartment: about 1000 sq feet, two bed/two full bath. Upgraded appliances to include stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and gorgeous, glossy concrete floors. Large balcony (with direct sliding door access from the living room and from master bedroom). Washer and dryer in unit. Updated/modern light fixtures. Floor to ceiling windows aka lots of natural light. Carpeted bedroom. Huge walk in closet (I`m a girl, it`s huge). The bedroom is unfurnished. The living room is furnished with an L shaped couch, coffee table, side table, a couple lamps, and a 60" smart HDTV. Dining area is furnished with a table and 4 chairs. There is not much room for living/dining room furniture. Plenty of wall space for wall art!
More about the bedroom: large! I have a queen bed, two bedside tables, a large dresser, a bookshelf, and a small ottoman and the room still feels spacious and not at all cramped. The walk in closet has a built in shelving system and is large enough that I was able to put a tall, skinny dresser in there as well. The bathroom is large, updated tile, medicine cabinet, under sink storage, full bathtub, and good water pressure! Floor to ceiling windows give it amazing natural light. As stated earlier, there is a sliding glass door that leads to the balcony.
Amenities of the building: see apartment`s website http://www.highlandparkdc.com/ but a couple of the best things, rooftop, 24 hour gym, 24 hour super nice front desk staff/concierge, key fob entry. LOCATION. Literally on top of the Columbia Heights metro. Across from IHOP, Panera, Target, 3-4 different banks, CVS, 7-11, The Heights, Starbucks, Chipotle, dry cleaners, pho!, etc. I don`t have a car, want a car, or need one. But it`s also an area full of parking for my friends/residents who do drive.
Your roommate to be: male, just turned 30, works in hospitality with strange hours, mostly consisting of late nights. One of the most fun, great spirited, responsible people I know. A great friend. Gives plenty of privacy, but down to share an after work conversation over a beer, or grab a bite to eat. Quiet enough that sometimes I`m not sure if he`s home. The only reason I`m leaving this wonderful guy and apartment is simply because I must relocate for work. Your roommate to be is looking for someone who is chill, easy going but responsible, doesn`t mind his strange schedule, is clean and tidy (but not OCD about it), and most importantly pays the bills on time. Most likely no pets, though he miiiiight be able to be talked into it (BIG maybe). Male roommate preferred, though female might be considered.
Details on moving in: the date is open, but shooting for Septemeber 1st-ish with the possibility of mod August but I`m not completely sure. I am still finalizing my new spot. The steps you need to take to move in as far as the building is concerned, $250 deposit, and a credit and background check with an application (which wasn`t more than $50 if I remember correctly). My name would then be removed from the lease, and yours would be added. This is not a sublet. The lease is up February 2015.
Rent: $1475 not including electric, gas, or cable/Internet. Water and sewer/garbage are included. All said and done, the total usually ends up around $1550. Parking is available at both the garage attached to the building, and there are others located just across the street for slightly cheaper. I don`t drive/have a car so I`m not sure exactly how much it is a month. But I can of course look into it for you.
I think that`s all! We hope to hear from you soon! Please don`t hesitate to contact me with any questions, or if you`re interested in checking out the place and meeting your future roommate!

postings.body:
**Absolutely Sept 1st move into a house a must! Rent is between $850 - $1000 per room. check out this house: http://losangeles.craigslist.org/wst/apa/4570611298.html
**I am not married to this property, but willing to check out other good living solution in Weho, Hollywood, Los Feliz, Echo Park, NoHo, and anywhere north of 10 freeway.
**We attempt to view several properties that agrees with everyone.
** FYI, I have fair among of modern and retro furniture to cover all share areas.
What I am looking for in a roommate:
- Mid 20`s to 40`s, Prefer gay or bi male dude, may consider str8 dude. Female and couples OK.
- Must have verifiable employment and pay rent on time. Locals prefer who has acclimated to L.A., people with big city attitude is a plus
- Prefer cool, creative, and intelligent people!
- No stranger attitude! Sociable personality that gets alone with most people is a plus. where we can have movie nights, Saturday BBQ, Sunday Brunch, and going out to cool places and events. Friday`s - group sex, just kidding!
- I am interested in rooming with people who are sexually very free. So gay roommate prefer!
- Must be very very clean, neat, organized, and not leaving things all over the place in share areas
- Prefer mature attitude, considerate, easy to live with, fair head on their shoulder, straight shooter, and very very cool liberal minded people.
- Not looking for constant party people at home, but am open to having friends gathering with happy times. Playing with recreational drug O.K. who are responsible. But let`s not have cops knocking at our door man!
Do not apply if:
-- If you got lot of personal hang ups about things.
-- Constantly negative, angry at the world, rude, hater, dirty, or people that just don`t get it!
-- No codependent, over needy personality, Jackal and Hyde mood swings.
-- People who likes to create unnecessary drama or people who constantly get shit happening to them (ya know the shit out of luck people). The good drama can stay!
About me:
- Liberal and upscale minded, professional creative & Artist type, partial type A personality, spiritual person, gay Asian Male, 41 y.o. (looks between 28 - 32 as I always get told). From Malaysia, grew up in Houston, and went to College in Chicago. Been in L.A. 10 yrs. Am single, dating, and got a few indoor/outdoor cats.
I am a professional interior architect, including backgrounds in architecture, landscape design, custom furniture/lighting design, graphic/web design presently trying to establish my design firm. I make $40/hr with a design firm and $85.00/hr with my own clients! Will be mostly working from home, until renting outside office is necessary for me!
Tentatively speaking, I am also in the process of partnering with someone to opening up a film production company. Will see where that takes me!
I am also a multi-medium fine artist into many forms of art and photography. Also presently trying to built my resume through showing my works in commercial galleries.
If I am not doing any of the above, I maybe sewing and fashion designing a garment. My aspiration is to put out a fashion collections for mass market consumer.
While living with me, you may hear me training my voice and working on my acting skills as I just recently became a working actor trying to become SAG and getting an agent.
In short, I am aspiring creative and entrepreneur trying to nail down my business before going back to graduate school to become a film director at AFI. Yea, I am pretty much the bomb, just kidding!
Naw, just trying my hardest to make a great life for myself for the future, as I do enjoy the luxury lifestyle and being pamper living atop of Hollywood Hill with hot boys servicing me!!!
I am mature, friendly, considerate, somewhat easy going, and straight shooter/clear communicator. Mostly clean, neat, and organize person. Sometime chilled and laid back, or have not a care in the world, but can sometime be bitchy cause can`t wait to become very rich and successful! Oh, I can be very wild and crazy at times, flamboyant, party it up, and love great sex with men only! Mostly I am serious at working my career!
When responding:
Be detailed and thorough, tell me about yourself and your situation, include a face pic or Facebook and phone number.

LAST MINUTE DEAL - $700/WEEK - AUGUST 2-9TH - ($963.40, Includes ALL Fees AND Taxes) - 2-BEDROOM CONDO ON THE BEACH WITH HEATED POOL - INDIAN SHORES, FL
All the comforts of home await you at our spacious, 1100 sq. Ft., 2-bedroom/2-bathroom condo directly on the beach in Indian shores. A large heated pool, BBQ grills, picnic area, and free WiFi are available in all condos, on the balconies, around the pool and cool paver deck surrounding our building. Step out onto the beach and the warm waters of the gulf are 50 feet in front of you.
The soft white sandy beach is the perfect place to take a leisurely stroll, listening to the soft gentle surf of the gulf. Enjoy volleyball, swimming, snorkeling, boogie boarding, para sailing and jet skiing. Every day watch dolphins travel the gulf coastline.
Our condo has been furnished with comfort and convenience in mind. The living room has over sized sofa, club chair and recliners, and the sofa opens to a queen-sized bed. Sliding glass doors lead out to our private balcony, where you can enjoy sitting and reading a book with your morning coffee. Our balcony offer a view of the tropical foliage and palm trees of Tiki gardens, a park across the street. New flat screen TVs, all with cable, are in the living room and each bedroom.
The living room is the perfect place for your family to relax together after spending a day at the beach or one of the many activities offered in the area. Watch movies on DVD (our onsite management office offers free DVD rentals, and also free bicycle rentals).
The master bedroom has a comfortable queen-sized bed, with pillow-top mattress, flat screen cable TV, and full private bath. The second bedroom has one double bed and one twin bed, both with pillow-top mattresses. The second bedroom has a flat screen cable TV and separate full bath (accessible from the living space and located right outside the bedroom door).
Amenities like stereo, alarm clock radios, iron, hairdryers, beach chairs, and other comforts of home are available in our condo.
The fully equipped kitchen has everything you need to cook and serve a gourmet meal to your family. There is a separate dining area with a large table that seats six, and a breakfast bar with seating for five located between the dining area and kitchen. postings.body:
I recently took a reduction in salary and now I am looking for clean quiet roommates to share my home.
I am looking for professionals or quiet students.
The apartment is about 1500 sq. ft. and it includes a living room, dinning room, bathroom, and kitchen. The bathroom and kitchen are currently being remodeled.
The neighborhood is clean and quiet. There is on street parking. The light rail train from Bayonne, NJ goes directly to Hoboken, which makes it convenient if you work there or go to school there at Steven`s. A monthly train pass is around $65.00 and takes about 30 minutes.
There are connecting PATH train stops to WTC, Grove Street, Journal Square, Harrison, or Newark, Penn Station at Exchange place. To get to 33rd Street New York connect at Pavonia Newport (Mall) or Hoboken. The weekend schedule is a little different. The PATH train is an additional fare.
Bedroom 1 is 10.5` x 9` and has a large closet.
Bedroom 2 is 10` x 9` and has a large closet.
 The bedrooms are freshly painted and have windows, and you have the use of the apartment.
The Apartment is furnished and the bedrooms can be partially furnished.
To get to Bayonne you catch the 8th street Lightrail train at Hoboken Train Station toward Bayonne and get off at 34th Street. Then you walk about 3 blocks on Avenue E. There are bars and Restaurants close by and a few shopping malls. The park with the running track on the river is about 6 blocks away. My Powertec weights are in the basement. They really need to be used.
The rent $600.00 includes all utilities.
Roommates must be willing to help clean their mess in the apartment.
I am seeking male roommates. Straight, Bi, or Gay okay. I am not looking for anyone who has a revolving door policy, but you can entertain overnight guests.
I`m older, 57, and I`m also gay. I`m an English teacher and a Chef Instructor. Yes, I`m a really good cook.
Please send me a detailed message. If you are a foreign student and can`t write English that well, I will understand. I will respond with my phone number and we can meet.
Thanks
Louis
I speak Spanish.
Hablo Espanol.

postings.body:
GORGEOUS, COMFY FOREST-THEMED ROOM IN A BEAUTIFULLY RESTORED, HISTORIC CRAFTSMAN HOUSE IN ELMWOOD DISTRICT OF BERKELEY
Available July Dates: July 27, 28 & 30
Luxurious private guest rooms for rent by the night or week in a gorgeously restored Craftsman home within walking distance of shopping, restaurants, and UC Berkeley. Renters have free access to the immaculately clean and well-equipped kitchen, the cozy living room, the large dining room, the breezy porch, and the sunny yards.
- Queen sized bed (sleeps 2) with Memory Foam topper and goose down bedding.
- Chair futon (sleeps 1 extra person) with goose down bedding.
- Antique desk/chair for work or study.
- Large closet with dresser for your things.
- Free organic breakfast!
- Endless coffee and tea bar.
- Linen and Towel Service.
- Wireless Internet.
- Iron/ironing board.
- Central heating, plus in-room heaters.
- Extra blankets, towels, and pillows.
- Cable TV with HBO, Showtime, and Starz.
- Front porch with wicker seating to enjoy the neighborhood.
- Large, remodeled chef`s kitchen, fully equipped.
- Formal dining room with long, antique oak table for 8, plus small bistro table.
- 2 large, sparkling clean bathrooms with shampoos, soaps, and towels provided.
- Walk to campus, shops.
- Clawfoot tub & showers.
- Beautiful antiques.
- Gorgeous private yard areas with a BBQ grill.
- Family/Kid Friendly (Pack N Play, child gate at stairs, kids books and toys).
- Close to BART/Bus.
- Lots of extras!
THE MUIR WOODS ROOM: 14 1/2 ft x 12 1/2 ft (181 square feet)
Sleep and relax in a large, rustic, nature-themed room with a comfortable queen-sized bed, a desk and chair, a dresser for your clothes, end tables and lamps, a closet with hangers and hamper, your own iron and ironing board, and extra blankets for those cool nights.
The Muir Woods Room pays homage to Muir Woods National Monument, established in 1908 when President Roosevelt signed legislation to protect the land. Its trees` ages range from 400 to 800 years, and their height up to 250 feet.
CLEAN AND GREEN
We provide green living supports (recycling, composting, chemical-free bath products, etc.). Each person cleans up after themselves immediately after meals and other activities in common areas. Your host does regular deep cleaning of the entire house. Cleaning products are chemical-free and unscented (Seventh Generation and Dr. Bronners), so you`ll smell only the fresh air.
WHOLE HOUSE PRIVILEGES
The kitchen is outfitted with high quality stainless steel appliances, a restaurant-style stove/oven, granite countertops, and beautiful lighting. It is fully equipped with pots & pans, utensils, and even cooking oils and spices for your use. A guest fridge and hutch gives you extra space for your personal food items. The living room is furnished with a green velvet Victorian sofa set and additional sofas to accommodate large groups, a library of reading materials, digital cable TV, extra pillows and throws for your comfort, and maps/guidebooks of Berkeley and San Francisco. The formal dining room is set up for ease of use by visitors, with a coffee pot, tea kettle, teapots, and toaster on the ready; and a hutch supplied with organic cereals, dried fruit & nuts, breads, coffee, cocoa, and tea. A private yard is furnished with teak outdoor furniture. A pretty front porch is also furnished with seating so you can enjoy the evening air and the campus-area ambiance.
INCLUDED
Price includes all utilities, free breakfast, weekly housekeeping, groundskeeping, weekly linen & towel service, wi-fi, nationwide phone calling, and endless coffee and tea. All you need is your suitcase!
LENGTH OF STAY/LIMITS
Rooms are available by the day or week. The home is located in a mixed residential area, so we prefer quiet, low-key executives/professionals,visiting scholars, or families who keep normal hours.
ROOMS and BATHROOM
The Muir Woods Room is one of five rooms, each fully furnished with king or queen beds (one has a twin), luxury down bedding, lamps, irons/ironing boards, closets, and desks, and several have additional futons and reading/sitting areas. Bathrooms are shared, and sharing is made simple with color-coordinated towels matched to your room, towel hooks in your room, toiletry bins in the bathroom, and plenty of extra cabinet and shelf space.
NOT A PARTY HOUSE.
If you`re looking for a place to party, this is not the place for you. We are located on a quiet, residential street, with school-aged children living next door, and we respect our neighbors` quality of life.
VERIFICATION OR SPAM/SCAM CONTROL
Because of scams and spam, I do not reply to emails without your full name, the dates you`d like to stay, your reason for coming to the Bay Area, and the number of guests. I`m happy to offer verification and reviews of my own. For your security and mine, I supply my guests with a formal rental agreement that is produced by the California Association of Realtors. You can verify our legitimacy through Google, where you will find us on Yelp, Home Away, Trip Advisor, and other public listings (or see our links below).
RECENT REVIEWS:
May, 2014: "Excellent, homey, perfect!!! Location was great for a Mom with a Berkeley student. The home was clean, comfy, quality and just relaxing!! Our host had parking permits for me so having a car was not a worry. The organic breakfast items were plentiful and fresh!! I would highly recommend staying here!!!! I will be seeing Amy again in the fall!! Thanks!!!" Brenda R., Massachusettes
May, 2014: "Amy is the best! So friendly, and she really helped me out when i made a small error on my booking dates. The house and room were so well furnished. Lovely organic food and classic furniture. Also- Berkeley is a great place. The house is in between Elmwood and Telegraph, so loads of restaurants and things to do really nearby. This is the perfect place to stay if you`re looking to spend time in the leafy east bay." Stephen O., Ireland
April, 2014: "This was my third short stay ... and, again, it was a delight. Amy cares a lot about the comfort of her guests, providing them everything to make them feel like at home, from a vast choice of organic and fresh goodies for breakfast to whatever you would need (or have forgotten) for your stay: towels, hair-dryer, body wash etc... I even found a chocolate from the Easter Bunny with my set of towels, that was so sweet! As always the house was very quiet (despite that all the rooms were occupied this time) and comfy (it felt so good with the cold and gray days we had this end of week!) and the guests very polite. This is my first choice place when I have to come in Berkeley!" - Stephanie V., USA
April, 2014: "My daughter and I spent 3 wonderful evenings here this past weekend and would absolutely visit again. The location is perfect and in a very safe neighborhood - within walking distance to shops and restaurants. We had breakfast there every morning and were able to cook in the evenings, as the home is equipped with a high end gas stove. I`ve never stayed in a B&B with shared bathrooms, but it was never an issue. It is a well maintained, clean, comfortable and relaxing place to stay. Amy is a wonderful host and very attentive to any needs you may have." - Cathy B., So Cal
"For my visit to the university, the guesthouse was perfectly located in a very nice neighborhood south of campus. Amy is certainly one of the best organized proprietors I have ever met, so the stay was very pleasant and uncomplicated. Many thanks. If I ever come to Berkeley again, the place is bookmarked." - Malte Z., from Germany, December 2013.
"The house is quiet, clean, and it is provided with anything you may need. Nice place and very conveniently located to reach the campus. I will certainly recommend this place!" - Martina O., Germany, November 2013.
"The guesthouse looks great, everything from bathrooms, bedrooms and living room, all were lovely. The bed was very comfortable! We even could cook dinner in the nice big kitchen. We can recommend staying here! We stayed for four nights and could relax and reach San Francisco easily." - Anne L., Norway, November 2013.
MORE INFO:
Take a look: www.homestaybythebay.com

Visit my website: www.LevineTravel.com
Levine Travel offers vacation condo accommodations of private, individually-owned condos on Florida`s Central Gulf Coast. Located along the 15-mile long barrier island of Sand Key, the communities I service include Indian Shores, Indian Rocks Beach, Madeira and Redington Beaches, all of which offer the very best of Florida for your family vacations.
My family and I have been vacationing in the Indian Shores/Indian Rocks Beach area for almost 30 years, and I have been a condo owner since 2004. I offer the unique perspective of both renter and owner, as I have rented condos for my own family vacations, in many of the same buildings I now offer to you for your vacation.
Visit for as little as 3 nights, or stay as long as a week, month or longer, I guarantee your vacation will be filled with wonderful memories. Conveniently located between Clearwater and St. Pete Beach, and just 20 minutes from Tampa, my condos offer you a home away from home for you and your family to enjoy a fantastic beach getaway.
After a fun-filled day on the beach or at one of Tampa`s theme parks, you will enjoy the relaxing atmosphere of your luxury vacation rental. Sit on your private balcony and watch the breathtaking sunsets over Florida`s beautiful gulf coast. I offer a variety of accommodations, from quaint beachside cottages to luxury condominiums, providing you with the amenities of home and all with the added bonus of the soft white sand beaches of Indian Shores and Indian Rocks Beach. Enjoy spacious living rooms, fully-equipped kitchens and comfortable bedrooms.
Amenities include beach front and ocean views, where you step out your door onto the white sandy beach, swimming pools, spas, gas grills and tennis courts. Surrounded by casual to award-winning gourmet restaurants, with the freshest seafood caught right off our shores, fishing, golfing, or just reading a book on the beach, Tampa Bay has something for everyone. So pack a bathing suit, suntan lotion and your favorite pair of flip flops. Everything else you need is awaits you and your family at your dream vacation getaway.

The room is named after Wildcat Canyon, a valley just east of the Berkeley Hills, where visitors love to go hike and picnic along Jewel Lake and Lake Anza. Wildcat Canyon was named for the mountain lions which used to be fairly common in the regional park.

NOT A PARTY HOUSE

Amy is a wonderful host and very attentive to any needs you may have." - Cathy B., So Cal

postings.body:
GORGEOUS, COMFY AND SPARKLING CLEAN ROOM IN A BEAUTIFULLY RESTORED, HISTORIC CRAFTSMAN GUESTHOUSE
Aren`t you sick of noisy, lonely, boxed-in hotel rooms? Try our guesthouse instead, where you can spread out and relax in the living room, meet fellow travelers in the dining room, enjoy the privacy of your own fully furnished room, cook in a fully equipped kitchen, use the outdoor grill, and relax in the yard or on the front porch. Quiet hours from 10 pm - 7 am mean you`ll get a good night`s sleep!
Usual Summer Rate $89-$99/night or $600/wk
(Rates vary based on season and are higher in summer, lower in winter)
Features:
- Free organic breakfast!
- Endless coffee and tea bar
- Plush queen sized bed
- Handmade teak desk/chair for work or study
- Large closet
- Weekly Linen and Towel Service
- Luxurious down bedding
- Wireless Internet
- Iron/ironing board
- Central heating
- Space heater and fan
- Extra blankets, towels, throws, and pillows
- Cable TV
- Walk to campus, shops, grocery, bus, BART
- Family/Kid Friendly
- Lots of extras!
THE BAYSHORE ROOM is the brightest room in a 5-bedroom/2 bath house, with wrap-around windows that show off the neighborhood and let in the cool breeze or the warm sun. Its comfortable queen sized bed (sleeps 2) is firm and topped with a 2-inch Memory foam pad for a plush experience. You`ll sleep beneath a thick, down comforter and rest on goose feather and down pillows. Lots of extra blankets, throws, and pillows ensures a comfy night`s sleep. The teak desk and chair are handmade locally by the fine craftsmen of the Wooden Duck. A closet contains hangers, hamper, your own iron and ironing board, a heater and fan, and extra blankets for cool nights.
Families can pair this room with the small Angel Island Room for an additional $60 to form a two-room suite, which can be made completely private by closing a hallway door that can divide the two rooms from the rest of the house.
This room is an homage to the bay area`s coastal environments, from the bay shores at the nearby Berkeley Marina to the crashing waves of the Pacific Ocean against the rocky shores along Highway 1. Stintson Beach, Muir Beach, and Point Reyes National Seashore are less than an hour away.
CLEAN AND GREEN
We provide green living supports (recycling, composting, chemical-free bath products, etc.), but we`re not the green police. Each person cleans up after themselves immediately after meals and other activities in common areas. Your host does regular deep cleaning of the entire house. Cleaning products are chemical-free and unscented (Seventh Generation and Dr. Bronners), so you`ll smell only the fresh air.
WHOLE HOUSE PRIVILEGES
The kitchen is outfitted with high quality stainless steel appliances, a restaurant-style stove/oven, granite countertops, and beautiful lighting. It is fully equipped with pots & pans, utensils, and even cooking oils and spices for your use. A guest fridge and hutch gives you extra space for your personal food items. The living room is furnished with a green velvet Victorian sofa set and additional sofas to accommodate large groups, a library of reading materials, digital cable TV, extra pillows and throws for your comfort, and maps/guidebooks of Berkeley and San Francisco. The formal dining room is set up for ease of use by visitors, with a coffee pot, tea kettle, teapots, and toaster on the ready; and a hutch supplied with organic cereals, dried fruit & nuts, breads, coffee, cocoa, and tea. A private yard is furnished with teak outdoor furniture. A pretty front porch is also furnished with seating so you can enjoy the evening air and the campus-area ambiance.
INCLUDED
Price includes all utilities, weekly housekeeping, groundskeeping, weekly linen & towel service, wi-fi, nationwide phone calling, and endless coffee and tea. All you need is your suitcase! You clean up after yourself in the kitchen and other common areas (wash own dishes, wipe up after cooking, etc.).
LENGTH OF STAY/LIMITS
This is a short-term vacation rental and not appropriate for long term residence. The home is located in a mixed residential area, so we prefer quiet, low-key executives/professionals,visiting scholars, or families who keep normal hours.
NOT A PARTY HOUSE.
If you`re looking for a place to party, this is not the place for you. We are located on a quiet, residential street, with school-aged children living next door, and we respect our neighbors` quality of life.
ROOMS and BATHROOM
There are 5 rooms which vary in size and share 2 bathrooms (to see them all: www.homestaybythebay.com). Bathroom sharing is made simple with color-coordinated towels matched to your room, towel hooks in your room, toiletry bins in the bathroom, and plenty of extra cabinet and shelf space. None of our rooms have a private bathroom inside them.
VERIFICATION OR SPAM/SCAM CONTROL
Because of scams and spam, I do not reply to emails without your full name, the dates you`d like to stay, your reason for coming to the Bay Area, and the number of guests. You can verify our legitimacy through Google, where you will find us on Yelp, Home Away, Trip Advisor, and other public listings (or see our links below).
RECENT REVIEWS:
May, 2014: "Excellent, homey, perfect!!! Location was great for a Mom with a Berkeley student. The home was clean, comfy, quality and just relaxing!! Our host had parking permits for me so having a car was not a worry. The organic breakfast items were plentiful and fresh!! I would highly recommend staying here!!!! I will be seeing Amy again in the fall!! Thanks!!!" Brenda R., Massachusettes
May, 2014: "Amy is the best! So friendly, and she really helped me out when i made a small error on my booking dates. The house and room were so well furnished. Lovely organic food and classic furniture. Also- Berkeley is a great place. The house is in between Elmwood and Telegraph, so loads of restaurants and things to do really nearby. This is the perfect place to stay if you`re looking to spend time in the leafy east bay." Stephen O., Ireland
April, 2014: "This was my third short stay ... and, again, it was a delight. Amy cares a lot about the comfort of her guests, providing them everything to make them feel like at home, from a vast choice of organic and fresh goodies for breakfast to whatever you would need (or have forgotten) for your stay: towels, hair-dryer, body wash etc... I even found a chocolate from the Easter Bunny with my set of towels, that was so sweet! As always the house was very quiet (despite that all the rooms were occupied this time) and comfy (it felt so good with the cold and gray days we had this end of week!) and the guests very polite. This is my first choice place when I have to come in Berkeley!" - Stephanie V., USA
April, 2014: "My daughter and I spent 3 wonderful evenings here this past weekend and would absolutely visit again. The location is perfect and in a very safe neighborhood - within walking distance to shops and restaurants. We had breakfast there every morning and were able to cook in the evenings, as the home is equipped with a high end gas stove. I`ve never stayed in a B&B with shared bathrooms, but it was never an issue. It is a well maintained, clean, comfortable and relaxing place to stay. Amy is a wonderful host and very attentive to any needs you may have." - Cathy B., So Cal
"I had a great time staying in the Angel Island room. For my visit to the university, the guesthouse was perfectly located in a very nice neighborhood south of campus. Amy is certainly one of the best organized proprietors I have ever met, so the stay was very pleasant and uncomplicated. Many thanks. If I ever come to Berkeley again, the place is bookmarked." - Malte Z., from Germany, December 2013.
"My mother has stayed ... a few times now, and really enjoys the experience. The neighborhood is appealing. Right around the house it`s fairly quiet, but just 2 blocks away is the Elmwood shopping district, with lots of restaurants, cafes, shops, an indy bookstore and even a branch of the Berkeley Public Library. Good bus transportation within a block. My mother has stayed in a handful of guesthouses over the past two months, and this has been her favorite." - Michaela P., Berkeley, CA, November 2013.
"My husband and I stayed in the Bayshore Room for several days in August, 2013. We loved the room, which was decorated in soothing tones of cream, blue, and green. The windows on three sides gave us plenty of light and a great breeze. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of blankets. The house is well maintained and furnished with lots of great old pieces fitting with the period, while the bathrooms are completely updated. [The proprietor] has taken great care with everything. There was plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the shower. This is really important when you`re traveling. ... We would definitely stay at [this] lovely guesthouse again." - Naomi L., Chicago, IL, August 2013.
